flawed_nl_solution:
Since a dozen is equal to 12, then 3 dozen eggs are equal to 12 x 3 = <<3*12=36>>36 eggs.
Tricia will use 36 x 1/4 = <<36*1/4=144/1>>144/1 eggs for making crepes.
So there are 36 - 144/1 = <<36-144/1=-108>>-108 eggs left.
-108 x 2/3 = <<-108*2/3=-72>>-72 eggs will be used for making cupcakes.
Thus, there are only -108 - -72 = <<-108--72=-36>>-36 eggs left to make sunny-side-up eggs for breakfast.
#### -36

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 9, not 144/1. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
